attributes.action: Spend the increased fuel duty revenue from the October 1st increase on transport
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In 1999, when Mr Brown was Chancellor, he said in his pre-Budget report: “If there are any real term rises in road fuel duties, the revenues will go straight to a ring-fenced fund for the modernisation of roads and public transport.”

The October 1st 2p rise in fuel duty is going into the Treasury's consolidated fund for the general public spending rather than being earmarked for transport.

The motorist is an easy source of revenue for the government, and little is returned to improve their situation. Return these funds as real improvements to the transport infrastructure as was promised.
